contents: The value of the Senate filibuster is controversial. In the U.S. Senate, a filibuster is a long speech made by a senator or group of senators that cannot be stopped unless 60 senators vote (1) <u>to</u> end (1) <u>debate</u>. (1) <u>Filibusters</u> give a stronger voice to the minority party and can be used to stop a senate vote on a bill.
